column4: I have a network drive mounted using samba but I'm running into problems.. I get a permission denied error  every time I try and save a file.  I can open them fine though.  When I do an ls -l in the directory it says that I have all the correct permissions.. Does anybody know what could be going on?
maybe the samba server doesn't allow anyone write access to the share?
how would I check that?  I have ssh access to the server
i haven't played around with samba for quite some time, but i believe its specified in the config file where you specified the share in the first place.
